FragilityCurve.Description: Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel. Assumed framing: 1 SIDE: 3/8" OSB or 15/32 ply with 8d box nails at 4 to 6 inches along panel edges and 12 inches field nailing. DF #2, 2x4@16 studs. 1 SIDE: 1/2 gypsum board. Panel 8 feet tall, 8 or 16 feet long with or without door and window openings, double top plate, single bottom plate, with hold-downs. Three layer 7/8" stucco with 1/2-inch chop strand fibers applied over wire mesh fastened with 1.25 -inch long staples.
FragilityCurve.Name: Exterior Wall - Light framed wood walls with structural panel sheathing, stucco, hold-downs
FragilityCurve.Author: Andre Filiatrault
FragilityCurve.Notes: Copy of B1071.002 for use as an exterior wall. ConsequenceGroup.RepairMeasures: Clean stucco cracks. Fill cracks with cement compound. Repaint wall to hide cracks.

DamageState.Description: Spalling of stucco, separation of stucco and sheathing from studs.

ConsequenceGroup.RepairMeasures: Remove loose stucco and patch spalled areas with stucco. Repaint to hide repairs.

DamageState.Description: Fracture of studs, major sill plate cracking.

ConsequenceGroup.RepairMeasures: Remove and replace studs, plates, sheathing, and stucco. Shore as required.
